This is a tracking bug for Change: QGnomePlatform For more details, see: https://fedoraproject.org//wiki/Changes/QGnomePlatform
QGnomePlatform is a Qt Platform Theme aimed to accomodate as much of GNOME settings as possible and utilize them in Qt applications without modifying them - making them fit into the environment as well as possible.

On 2016-Feb-23, we have reached Fedora 24 Change Checkpoint: Completion deadline (testable).
At this point, all accepted changes should be substantially complete, and testable. Additionally, if a change is to be enabled by default, it must be so enabled at Change Completion deadline.
Change tracking bug should be set to the MODIFIED state to indicate it achieved completeness.
Incomplete and non testable Changes will be reported to FESCo on 2016-Feb-26 meeting. Contingency plan for System Wide Changes, if planned for Alpha (or in case of serious doubts regarding Change completion), will be activated.

On 2016-Apr-19 we reached the "Change Checkpoint: 100% Code Complete Deadline" milestone for Fedora 24 release. At this point all the Changes not at least in in "ON_QA" state should be brought to FESCo for review. Please update the state of this bug to "ON_QA" if it is already 100% completed. Please let me know in case you have any trouble with the implementation and the Change needs any help or review.
Thanks, Jan
The change is complete as we planned to be. I just pushed some latest upstream fixes and improvements to be sure that this feature works as it should.

I have added release notes text to the draft F24 Release Notes here: https://git.fedorahosted.org/cgit/docs/release-notes.git/patch/?id=466ce9074a719deb5218b9bd7d26640246e2ea9f
Please would you take a look at the draft and let me know if anything should be added or changed?

Looks good, except the section about configuration on two places, there is no place where you can setup appearance for Qt applications, this was always done internally on some basic level by other Qt Platform themes provided by Qt itself.

To make it accurate, I'm talking about pure Qt applications, you can of course configure appearance of KDE applications when KDE Platform integration plugin is used. With QGnomePlatform the previously mentioned KDE Platform integration plugin is not used anymore and only configuration provided by QGnomePlatform is applied.

Thanks for the feedback, Jan. I have edited the text to remove my error. Please would you look at https://git.fedorahosted.org/cgit/docs/release-notes.git/patch/?id=5879bfecc2213a717dce9e51ae2b0d17c456a59f and confirm that the new text is now correct?
